title: 107_s1042
content: The Act titled "Filipino Veterans' Benefits Improvements Act of 2001" establishes the rate of payment for certain benefits for new Philippine Scouts residing in the United States. The Act redesignates provisions in Section 107 of title 38, United States Code, and adjusts the rate of payment for benefits. The amendments made by subsection (b) have an effective date. The amendments made by subsection (b) in Section 107 of title 38, United States Code, will take effect on the date of enactment of this Act and apply to benefits paid for months starting on or after that date. SEC. 3. Rate of Payment of Dependency and Indemnity Compensation for Surviving Spouses of Certain Filipino Veterans. Amends section 107 of title 38, United States Code, to include benefits under chapter 13. Effective upon enactment and applies to benefits from that date. SEC. 4. Eligibility of Certain Filipino Veterans for Disability Pension. Amends section 107 of title 38, United States Code to include benefits under chapter 15 for certain individuals. Amends section 107 of title 38, United States Code to include benefits under chapter 15 for certain individuals. The new subsection specifies that benefits paid to individuals in the United States who are citizens or lawful residents will not be subject to certain conditions, while benefits paid to individuals in the Republic of the Philippines will be at a rate of $100 per month. The amendments made by this section will take effect upon the enactment of the Act and apply to benefits starting from that date. SEC. 5. ELIGIBILITY OF FILIPINO VETERANS FOR HEALTH CARE IN THE UNITED STATES. Amends section 1734 of title 38, United States Code to provide hospital and nursing home care and medical services to Commonwealth Army veterans and new Philippine Scouts. SEC. 6. OUTPATIENT HEALTH CARE FOR VETERANS RESIDING IN THE PHILIPPINES. The amendment provides outpatient care and services for World War II veterans residing in the Philippines, with a limit of $500,000 in expenditures per fiscal year. The Secretary is authorized to furnish care and services to veterans and scouts for service-connected and nonservice-connected disabilities at the Manila VA Outpatient Clinic. The amendment authorizes outpatient care for World War II veterans in the Philippines with a $500,000 limit per fiscal year. The Secretary can provide care for service-connected and nonservice-connected disabilities at the Manila VA Outpatient Clinic. Subsection (a) is effective based on available appropriations, and a clerical amendment is made to the table of sections in chapter 17. The amendments authorize outpatient care for World War II veterans in the Philippines with a $500,000 limit per fiscal year. Effective on the date of enactment, the Secretary can provide care for service-connected and nonservice-connected disabilities at the Manila VA Outpatient Clinic.
